requests.name: Get Users
Access microsoft Graph login

headers.name: cache-control
headers.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

headers.name: content-length
headers.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

headers.name: content-type
headers.description: The mime type of this content

headers.name: date
headers.description: The date and time that the message was sent

headers.name: expires
headers.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

headers.name: p3p
headers.value: CP="DSP CUR OTPi IND OTRi ONL FIN"
headers.description: This header is supposed to set P3P policy, in the form of P3P:CP="your_compact_policy". However, P3P did not take off, most browsers have never fully implemented it, a lot of websites set this header with fake policy text, that was enough to fool browsers the existence of P3P policy and grant permissions for third party cookies.

headers.name: pragma
headers.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

headers.name: referrer-policy
headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: strict-transport-security
headers.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

headers.name: x-content-type-options
headers.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

headers.name: x-ms-ests-server
headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: x-ms-request-id
headers.description: Custom header
